Title: Next Vulnerable to Denial of Service with Server Components
Description:
A vulnerability affects certain React packages for versions 19.0.0, 19.0.1, 19.1.0, 19.1.1, 19.1.2, 19.2.0, and 19.2.1 and frameworks that use the affected packages, including Next.js 15.x and 16.x using the App Router. The issue is tracked upstream as [CVE-2025-55184](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2025-55184).

A malicious HTTP request can be crafted and sent to any App Router endpoint that, when deserialized, can cause the server process to hang and consume CPU. This can result in denial of service in unpatched environments.
AffectedVersions: All versions starting from 13.3.0 before 14.2.34, all versions starting from 15.0.0-canary.0 before 15.0.6, all versions starting from 15.1.1-canary.0 before 15.1.10, all versions starting from 15.2.0-canary.0 before 15.2.7, all versions starting from 15.3.0-canary.0 before 15.3.7, all versions starting from 15.4.0-canary.0 before 15.4.9, all versions starting from 15.5.1-canary.0 before 15.5.8, all versions starting from 15.6.0-canary.0 before 15.6.0-canary.59, all versions starting from 16.0.0-beta.0 before 16.0.9, all versions starting from 16.1.0-canary.0 before 16.1.0-canary.17
NotImpacted: All versions before 13.3.0, all versions starting from 14.2.34 before 15.0.0-canary.0, all versions starting from 15.0.6 before 15.1.1-canary.0, all versions starting from 15.1.10 before 15.2.0-canary.0, all versions starting from 15.2.7 before 15.3.0-canary.0, all versions starting from 15.3.7 before 15.4.0-canary.0, all versions starting from 15.4.9 before 15.5.1-canary.0, all versions starting from 15.5.8 before 15.6.0-canary.0, all versions starting from 15.6.0-canary.59 before 16.0.0-beta.0, all versions starting from 16.0.9 before 16.1.0-canary.0, all versions starting from 16.1.0-canary.17
